name: 8 UMi
scenarioDescription:
The 8 UMi Exoplanetary System

8 UMi is a star with 1.44 times the mass of the Sun, and 10.3 times its radius. It is located 532.68 light years away from the solar system.

8 UMi is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

8 UMi b

8 UMi b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.49 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 93.40 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, 8 UMi.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.06, which means that when 8 UMi b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.46 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 0.52. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of 8 UMi b is 416.33 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 8 UMi b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 8 UMi, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
